main_definition: To increase in size, quantity, or value over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Increase in physical size or stature, usually from youth to adulthood.
meanings_and_examples.example: The child grew taller and stronger each year.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Development of plants through cell division, cell enlargement, and differentiation.
meanings_and_examples.example: The gardener nurtured the seeds to grow into healthy flowers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Increase in numbers or quantity; expansion.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company experienced significant growth over the past year, with more employees and higher sales.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To mature mentally or emotionally as one gains experience.
meanings_and_examples.example: After facing many challenges in his career, he grew wiser and more confident.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Improve or progress over time; advance in skill or knowledge.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has been growing her cooking skills by trying new recipes each week.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To develop a relationship, often used figuratively when referring to friendships or connections.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their friendship grew stronger as they spent more time together.
